text: Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: The heart will break, but broken live on.
author: Lord Byron

text: Pain makes you stronger, tears make you braver, heartbreak makes you wiser.
author: Anonymous

text: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The hottest love has the coldest end.
author: Socrates

text: Sometimes you have to forget what you feel and remember what you deserve.
author: Anonymous

text: Every ending is a new beginning.
author: Anonymous

text: The only way to fix a broken heart is time.
author: Anonymous

text: Hearts will never be practical until they are made unbreakable.
author: L. Frank Baum

text: Sometimes it takes a heartbreak to shake us awake and help us see we are worth so much more than we're settling for.
author: Mandy Hale

text: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: You can love someone so much, but you can never love people as much as you can miss them.
author: John Green

text: It is better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: The cure for anything is salt water: sweat, tears or the sea.
author: Isak Dinesen

text: Sometimes you have to stand alone to prove that you can still stand.
author: Anonymous

text: The hardest part about walking away from someone is when you realize that no matter how slow you go, they will never run after you.
author: Anonymous

text: Don't be afraid to start over. It's a brand new opportunity to rebuild what you truly want.
author: Anonymous

text: You were my cup of tea, but I drink coffee now.
author: Anonymous

text: Sometimes the best thing you can do is not think, not wonder, not imagine, not obsess. Just breathe and have faith that everything will work out for the best.
author: Kody Keplinger

text: The most beautiful people I've known are those who have known trials, have known struggles, have known loss, and have found their way out of the depths.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

text: Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.
author: Deborah Reber

text: One day you will tell your story of how you overcame what you went through and it will be someone else's survival guide.
author: Brené Brown
